actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Civil and Constitutional Rights.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Civil and Constitutional Rights

official_title: To require that an application for a writ of habeas corpus be submitted with the consent of the person for whose relief it is intended.
subjects: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

summary.text: Amends the Federal judicial code to provide that, in any appeal of a person convicted of a felony for which such person previously has been determined to be capable of aiding in his or her own defense, no other person may present an application for a writ of habeas corpus without the convicted person's consent or without showing that such convicted person is mentally incompetent.

titles.title: To require that an application for a writ of habeas corpus be submitted with the consent of the person for whose relief it is intended.
